page.title: 03R.A.F. -facilities
page.content: Residents on the camp have the use of a N.A.A.F.I. shop and a mobile vegetable van but no butcher or fishmonger. The library van visits once a fortnight, as does the health-visitor and midwife who travel from Selby.There is a medical centre, and at present a resident doctor. There is a play school 5 mornings a week which is available to village children on a limited basis. A thrift shop is open 1 afternoon a week, where R.A.F. and village people may sell second-hand goods, the profits going to local charities. The primary school children travel to either Church Fenton or Ulleskelf and secondary pupils to Tadcaster or Sherburn-in-Elmet, transport is provided for all schools.
